bug.short_desc: The asset syntax for icons should the situation arise coupled with the current theme.

long_desc.thetext:
In the current solution an icon can be added to the resources: a) directly: #asset("qx/icon/Tango/32/categories/office.png")
b) by a using a macro: #asset(qx/icon/${qx.icontheme}/32/categories/office.png)
a) has the disadvantage that the icon code is fix, so the code is not protected against theme changes. b) has the disadvantages that the icons from all theme will be copied, but typically the icon from only one theme is needed.
Therefore, is it better to copy the icon from the current theme, when the user do not specify an other icon from an other theme. This specification is important to support user defined icon selection.
If and/or how to continue to support macros in assets (looks like a temporary solution right now).
Is the ${qx.icontheme} still regarded a temporary solution we should address for the upcoming major releases? Fabian, Thomas, any suggestions?
mass renaming of 0.9 target to 1.0 (for issues with status "NEW")

I'm closing this bug now. It is not entirely clear (also not to Chris, who posted the bug), how to reproduce the issue, and unfortunately we don't have a sample app that shows this bug in qooxdoo-contrib/Bugs. In general, things like that should be sorted out by configuration, so resource information is not overgenerated in the final app, or too many resources being copied to the build version. So maby what Chris observed was due to a slip in the configuration. Hard to say now...
If this issue re-surfaces, the bug can be re-opened with a more tangible description and a sample app that reproduces the issue.
I have not definitive answer on the use of asset macros in general. Currently, it is the only way that we have, to inject information into the #asset hints - and thus into the entire resource handling - from outside (think: config).
